title: Is there relative grading for AIML
content: I am in 3rd sem rn. Was there relative or did you get higher grade than what you were supposed to for any subject.

comments.body: I really do hope we have relative grading. My isa 2 marks are really bad
Exactly, apparently aiml and ece might not have cuz our  branch strength is only 380 something
It depends on the course and how the batch performs in it. Relative grading is applied on a per-course basis.
As long as it depends on the marks its fine, cuz pretty much no one got above 33 in isa
It depends on the overall score that's obtained. Can't predict with just ISA marks. Plus, PES isn't transparent about these things either.
Yeah, only if they could display everything properly
I don't think it is dependent on the strength of the batch
I dont know. A senior told that their ece didnt have relative grading cuz of strength
Oh but isn't that very stupid? Doesn't average matter the most? But then again we can never know.
Bruh when are CSE results coming? I just wanna get it over with lol

If the highest total score in the entire batch is below 95/100 (including both ISAs and ESA) there’s likely to be some form of relative grading—at least, that’s what Jawahar said. However, they’re highly unpredictable, so take it with a grain of salt.
i have a feeling that these fools will release results 12 hours before webtech exam to mess with us.

Yeah totally can happen lol  
our WT teacher told me they have all finished correcting 2 days before itself

Ohh I am honestly not expecting much from them. But if what the chancellor said is true then we'll get relative grading unless someone ends up scoring 100/100 in the esa, because barely any people got 35 plus in both the isas
